metadata.name: HackTool - KrbRelayUp Execution
metadata.comment: Detects KrbRelayUp used to perform a universal no-fix local privilege escalation in Windows domain environments where LDAP signing is not enforced

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\krbrelayup.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('krbrelayup.exe') OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' relay ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -domain ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -computername ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' krbscm ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -sc ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' spawn ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -d ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -cn ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -cp '))))

output.summary: Detects KrbRelayUp used to perform a universal no-fix local privilege escalation in Windows domain environments where LDAP signing is not enforced
